author: zach-folwick
body: Added MMI.Native code. This allows users to create a ciminstance and properties using the Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure library. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/powershell/powershell/742)

comments.author: zach-folwick
comments.body:
blocked by #454.

We require OMI to access the MI library.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I thought you were working around this by committing the libraries directly.

comments.author: zach-folwick
comments.body: I was hoping to have done that with just copying libmi.so, but it relies on other things.  The other alternative (copying all of omi, or going through and figuring out each file needed by mi.h) is sub-optimal.  I think using a workaround would be just creating more work for someone else later, and doing it "right" the first time is the cheapest and best option.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: All right I've added the PowerShell CI user as an external collaborator with read-only access to OMI. Please try again.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @paulcallen Going to close this since it won't be merged; it'll stick around though for the changes.

title: Ciminstance
